intro: Serratula monardii var. abulensis, commonly known as the Abulensian goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
